summary.para: Sets construction variables for the &jar; utility.

Builds a Java archive (.jar) file from the specified list of sources. Any directories in the source list will be searched for .class files). Any .java files in the source list will be compiled to .class files by calling the &b-link-Java; Builder.

If the &cv-link-JARCHDIR; value is set, the &jar; command will change to the specified directory using the -C option. If &cv-JARCHDIR; is not set explicitly, &SCons; will use the top of any subdirectory tree in which Java .class were built by the &b-link-Java; Builder.
If the contents any of the source files begin with the string Manifest-Version, the file is assumed to be a manifest and is passed to the &jar; command with the m option set.
The directory to which the Java archive tool should change (using the -C option).
The command line used to call the Java archive tool.
The string displayed when the Java archive tool is called If this is not set, then &cv-link-JARCOM; (the command line) is displayed.
General options passed to the Java archive tool. By default this is set to cf to create the necessary jar file.
The suffix for Java archives: .jar by default.
